data.title: Christian Berkel: Movies, Photos, Videos, News, Biography & Birthday
data.meta_description: Christian Berkel: Check out the list of all Christian Berkel movies along with photos, videos, biography and birthday. Also find latest Christian Berkel news on Times of India.
data.text:
Gunmen offload passengers from vehicles in Pakistan, kill 23 after checking identities

timesofindia.com / Aug 26, 2024, 12:37 (IST)

In a tragic event in Baluchistan, Pakistan, armed assailants murdered 23 individuals after taking them from buses and trucks. The attack occurred in Kusakhail district, where at least 10 vehicles were set ablaze. The interior minister has condemned the attack, vowing to bring the culprits to justice. Separatists in the area have a history of such violence.

BJP releases first list of candidates J&K assembly elections, withdraws later

timesofindia.com / Aug 26, 2024, 12:06 (IST)

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) initially released a list of 44 candidates for the Jammu and Kashmir assembly elections but later withdrew it, opting to revise the list. Key candidates were named for constituencies like Anantnag, Doda, and Shopian in the first list. The elections are scheduled in three phases, starting September 18, with results on October 4.

As hate for India sweeps across Bangladesh, will Teesta talks suffer?

timesofindia.com / Aug 25, 2024, 18:23 (IST)

Remarks by two Bangladeshi officials on floods and Teesta row reflect a change in Dhaka’s attitude towards New Delhi. Analysts see this as a fallout of growing anti-India sentiments in the neighbouring country, which may harm bilateral ties with India

MHA announces five new districts in Ladakh

timesofindia.com / Aug 26, 2024, 12:31 (IST)

The ministry of home affairs announced the creation of five new districts in Ladakh, ahead of the Jammu & Kashmir assembly elections. The new districts, namely Zanskar, Drass, Sham, Nubra, and Changthang, aim to improve governance.

How Israel tracked and eliminated Hezbollah's 'ghost' commander Fuad Shukr

timesofindia.com / Aug 26, 2024, 09:32 (IST)

An Israeli airstrike in Beirut killed Hezbollah's military commander, Fuad Shukr, shortly after he was instructed to move to a more vulnerable location. The attack followed a deadly Hezbollah rocket strike on an Israeli town. Hezbollah and Iran have vowed revenge, while Israel remains silent on the incident. Shukr was pivotal in Hezbollah's military strategies and operations.

Now, Kannada actor Darshan's clipping of video call from jail goes viral

tnn / Aug 26, 2024, 11:45 (IST)

A video clip allegedly showing Kannada actor Darshan, a murder accused, engaging in a video call from Central Prison has led to the suspension of seven prison officials. The clip suggests Darshan and Dharma, a rowdy-sheeter, were conversing with an anti-social element named Sathya. Authorities are probing the incident further.

Is govt shielding Mollywood sex offenders and will HC expose them?

timesofindia.com / Aug 25, 2024, 14:33 (IST)

Why else would it insist on survivors — after all that they have gone through — to come forward with formal complaints? The high court is now the only hope

Why TRAI's ‘Sept 1 deadline’ for Airtel, Jio & Voda is ‘bad news’ for your OTPs

timesofindia.com / Aug 26, 2024, 00:36 (IST)

Starting September 1, consumers faced possible service disruptions from banks due to a Trai directive aimed at reducing spam. Trai instructed telecom companies to block messages with unwhitelisted URLs, APKs, or call-back numbers.

'Secret was out': Ex-Pak captain points out 'India' angle in defeat to B'desh

timesofindia.com / Aug 26, 2024, 10:14 (IST)

Pakistan suffered a massive defeat against Bangladesh at home, losing by 10 wickets. The loss has drawn criticism, particularly aimed at captain Shan Masood. Former cricketer Ramiz Raja attributed the defeat to poor team selection and the decline of Pakistan’s fast bowlers, linking it back to their performance in the Asia Cup against India.

Trump suggests he might skip Sept 10 debate with Harris on ABC News. But why?

timesofindia.com / Aug 26, 2024, 12:33 (IST)

Former President Donald Trump cast doubt on his participation in the September 10 debate against Vice President Kamala Harris, questioning ABC News' integrity. Trump's remarks have led to speculation about his withdrawal. Harris has been gaining in national polls, further intensifying the race. The Harris campaign had previously confirmed the debate schedule despite Trump's criticisms.
